summary: Emil Adolf von Behring  was a German doctor.
full_text: Emil von Behring , as Emil Adolf Behring born  was a German physiologist who received the 1901 Nobel Prize in Physiology or Medicine, the first one awarded, for his discovery of a diphtheria antitoxin. He was widely known as a "saviour of children," as diphtheria formerly was a major cause of child death. He was ennobled in 1901 for services to medicine.
title: Emil von Behring
